Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on free speech and a basic human right.
There are contentious issues that could be unfairly categorized as misinformation or disinformation.
The government should not decide what constitutes dangerous ideas, as many Australians can think for themselves.
Concerns about future misuse of the legislation by governments to suppress dissent.
Efforts to suppress information will lead to people seeking it on other platforms, potentially outside government reach.
Main Themes: Government overreach and potential misuse of power
Public's ability to discern information independently
Ineffectiveness of censorship in the digital age
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a most basic human right and a pillar of a democratic society.
You silence opposition and 'disinformation' on one platform and people will just seek out the information on other platforms in places the Australian Government canâ€™t reach.
